inclusion.criterion: Newborn infants admitted anywhere in the Neonate unit or Neonatal Unit of Paediatric
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Underwent lumbar puncture as part of the workup for sepsis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Cerebrospinal fluid visibly tinged with blood (macro traumatic). To ensure objectivity, two Pediatricians must have a consensus that the CSF sample is visibly blood-tinged when viewed in bright ambient light.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Clinically too unstable to undergo 2 lumbar punctures within the span of 48 hours
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Lumbar puncture performed after more than 3 doses of antibiotics administered
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient A is a 30-year-old male who was admitted to the hospital after 10 days of cough, profuse nocturnal sweating and loss of appetite. He had traveled to India 1 months ago and has not any positive history of TB vaccination.
